tradedash: Interactive Trading Dashboard for TradingVerse

Source: R/tradedash-package.R
tradedash-package.Rd

A comprehensive, production-ready Shiny dashboard application that integrates all TradingVerse packages into a unified interface. Features live market monitoring, strategy development, backtesting, performance analytics, and real-time visualization. Designed for quantitative traders and portfolio managers who need professional-grade tooling.

A comprehensive, production-ready Shiny dashboard that unifies all TradingVerse packages into a single, powerful interface. Designed for quantitative traders, portfolio managers, and financial analysts who need professional-grade tools.

Key Features

Live Market Monitoring

Real-time price charts, market scanner, alerts

Strategy Studio

Visual strategy builder with code generation

Professional Backtesting

One-click backtesting with visual results

Portfolio Management

Real-time tracking, position management, analytics

Advanced Analytics

Interactive charts, custom dashboards, reports

Quick Start


library(tradedash)

# Launch full dashboard
launch_dashboard()

# Launch specialized dashboards
launch_dashboard(mode = "live")      # Live market monitor
launch_dashboard(mode = "backtest")  # Backtest studio
launch_dashboard(mode = "portfolio") # Portfolio analytics

Dashboard Modes

Full (default)

Complete trading workstation with all features

Live

Real-time market monitoring and alerts

Backtest

Strategy development and testing

Portfolio

Portfolio management and risk analytics

Configuration

Create a YAML configuration file for customization:


theme: "dark"
refresh_rate: 5000
initial_capital: 100000
data_sources:
  primary: "yahoo"

Load with: launch_dashboard(config_file = "config.yaml")

Integration

tradedash integrates seamlessly with all TradingVerse packages:

  • tradeengine: Backtesting and strategy execution

  • tradeio: Data fetching and management

  • tradefeatures: Technical indicator calculation

  • tradeviz: Chart generation and visualization

  • trademetrics: Performance analytics and metrics

Main Functions

launch_dashboard

Launch the main trading dashboard

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic launch
launch_dashboard()

# Custom configuration
launch_dashboard(
  mode = "live",
  port = 3838,
  config_file = "my_config.yaml"
)

# Multi-monitor setup
launch_dashboard(mode = "live", port = 3838)      # Monitor 1
launch_dashboard(mode = "portfolio", port = 3839) # Monitor 2
launch_dashboard(mode = "backtest", port = 3840)  # Monitor 3
} # }
